p: The incidence and mortality rates of lung cancer are higher than those of other cancers [ 1]. The overall 5-year survival rate for lung cancer is only 15% [ 2]. Lung cancer is divided into small cell carcinoma (SCLC) and non-small-cell carcinoma (NSCLC). SCLC accounts for 10%-15% of lung cancers and is sensitive to radiotherapy and chemotherapy [ 3, 4]. However, approximately 85% of lung cancers are NSCLC [ 5]. The median survival time of patients with advanced lung cancer is only 10 months [ 6]. Although the diagnosis and treatment of lung cancer have significantly improved, the current treatment methods are still not satisfactory. Improved early diagnosis and targeted treatment of lung cancer are required in clinical practices to improve patient outcomes.
